title: Randstad – Current
description: Marriott Global HSIA Project 2nd Release This project involves working with more than eighteen internet service providers

tasks.description: Provide customized maintainable Responsive Web Design solutions based on not only business requirements of cross-browser/platform compatibility, Section 508 Compliance, 3rd party friendly and speed to market etc., but also considerations over both business and technical limitations.

Combine and use SASS, Compass, Scout, HTML5, CSS3, Sublime Text 2 and Google Chrome/Canary DevTools to convert wire-frames and mock-ups into prototypes rapidly to help proof concepts from cross-browser/platform perspective.

Work in eclipse Coordinate with backend- developers and other front-end developer to improve existing JSP templates as well as create new JSP templates to simplify site maintenance and ensure site performance. (First time working in JSP environment.)

Writting jQuery/JavaScript to add dynamic visual improvements/interactions such as collapsible forms, conditional links, and customized Omniture tracking to the site to meet user experience and marketing requirements. Using Test&Target with jQuery/JavaScript to support A/B testing and multivariate testing (MVT) with dynamic content.
Agile work with visual designers and back-end developers to identify and solve issues efficiently.

Work closely with designers to translate visual business requirements into front-end technical specifications. Communicate business requirements with more than eighteen internet service providers through emails, basecamp and bridge conference.
Help QA team with end to end lab testing together with developers from internet service providers’ side. Perform testing cross multiple browsers/devices and log defects.

title: SPARKS IT SOLUTIONS - 3
description: Children’s National Medical Center Web Developing Assignment

tasks.description: Developing and maintaining both static and dynamic content for homepage, news releases, web forms, images and other web pages cross browsers.
Managing site structures information and content through Marqui (content management system), Blogger, Whatcounts, Google Analytics and other database/content management tools.
Creating cross browser dynamic web interactions using HTML, HTML5, CSS3 Javascript, JQuery, ASP.Net and other commonly used markup/coding languages.
Us Javascript/JQuery to detect client device, create sliders, dropdowns, AJAX form fields, event-controlled elements and implement tracking.
Setting up domains and sub domains for blogs through multiple server hosting places such as godaddy.com and DNS Park etc.
Picking up Marqui rapidly and smoothly. Being able to learn from and show useful skills to other colleagues.
Researching and designing eLearning modules to run cross platforms and browsers.
Creating eLearning modules in multiple versions using Adobe Captivate, Photoshop, Flash, Premiere Pro and Media Encoder for various devices and browsers.
Building module page in Visual Studio 2010 using HTML, CSS, HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript and ASP.NET to ensure Section 508 Compliances.
Using browser detection to help choose and delivery corresponding content.

title: SPARKS IT SOLUTIONS - 1
description: The Nature Conservancy Site Migration Assignment.

tasks.description: Migrating various content including blog posts, legal terms, community links, announcements and calendar events to SharePoint powered web part pages.
Correcting and editing web content using HTML and web site structures using SharePoint 2010.
Making suggestions to and cooperating with multiple departments to update web sites.
Converting table structure content to SharePoint 2010 web parts for site links, tables, charts, rollups, and calendars etc.

title: NATIONAL OCEANIC AND ATMOSPHERIC ADMINISTRATION (NOAA)
description: Major programming in multiple tasks of building Water life, educational games, for NOAA. http://games.noaa.gov/ There are two projects I have done programming for: 'WaterLife - Sea Turtles and the Quest to Nest'; 'WaterLife - Where Rivers Meet the Sea'

tasks.description: Using ActionScript 3.0 OOP to program major mini games and game sections.
Using Flash to develop game objects, animations and graphics.
Using HTML to create web pages holding, displaying and sharing different versions of the project.
Using Google Group to exchange information during development in order to work distantly.
Using adobe premiere to create trailers for the projects.

title: LET ME THINK. CO
description: Major programming in multiple tasks of building My Own Biome, educationalgames, for Baltimore County Public Schools. http://myownbiome.com/

tasks.description: Using C# to program major game tools, interfaces, AI, features and functions. Started the project with limited experience in C#.
Using XNA/Visual Studio 2008/2010 as game engine.
Creating different versions of the game for Windows and XBox 360.
Using TortoiseSVN for version controls.
